page.title: 09Pendomer and Halstock: Roads
page.content: There are few roads and most of those that do exist are narrow and winding. None is classified; only one, the bus route from Yeovil to Halstock along the west side of the reservoir, is wide enough for two vehicles side by side throughout its length. Pendomer is approached by a road from East Coker and Hardington Mandeville, to the north-east. To get from Pendomer to Halstock one can go up this road and turn right following a steep, winding road which reaches Halstock via the church and school. There is a link road from it to the bus route. A road crosses the south-east corner of the block en route from Halstock to Closworth, and there are two other short lengths of minor road, one in the north-east and one from the school southward towards Halstock Leigh.
